bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, August 20, 1946

div1.p: Siler writes that he is looking forward to seeing Hench at the annual meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, August 20, 1946
div1.opener:
THE PRESIDENT
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
August 20, 1946
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have just been talking to General Kean and he tells me
that we can have the pleasure of seeing you at the annual meeting
of the Walter Reed Memorial Association in November providing we
can arrange to hold the meeting on Monday the 18th or Tuesday the
19th. It will be quite all right to arrange the meeting on either
one of those dates. Please let us know which of the two dates will
be most convenient for you.

We shall look forward with the very greatest of pleasure
to having you attend the meeting. The meeting usually is called to
order between ten and ten thirty in the forenoon in the Board Room
of the American Security and Trust Company at 15th Street and Penn-
sulvania Avenue, Northwest. The treasurer of the American Security
and Trust Company, Mr. Ireland, is also a member of our board.
With very best wishes, I am

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., U. S. A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed
Memorial Association
3434 - 34th Place, N.W.
Washington 16, D.C.
